parametrized_description: A grape farmer uses small and large crates to transport grapes. Each small crate holds SmallCrateCapacity grapes, and each large crate holds LargeCrateCapacity grapes. The number of small crates used must be at least MinimumSmallToLargeRatio times the number of large crates. The farmer can use up to MaxSmallCrates small crates and up to MaxLargeCrates large crates. Additionally, the truck can carry up to MaxTotalCrates crates in total, and at least MinLargeCrates large crates must be used. The objective is to determine the number of small and large crates to maximize the total number of grapes transported.

SmallCrateCapacity.description: Number of grapes a small crate can hold

LargeCrateCapacity.description: Number of grapes a large crate can hold

MinimumSmallToLargeRatio.description: Minimum ratio of small crates to large crates

MaxSmallCrates.description: Maximum number of small crates available

MaxLargeCrates.description: Maximum number of large crates available

MaxTotalCrates.description: Maximum number of crates the truck can carry

MinLargeCrates.description: Minimum number of large crates to be used

NumSmallCrates.description: The number of small crates used

NumLargeCrates.description: The number of large crates used

constraints.description: The number of small crates used must be at least MinimumSmallToLargeRatio times the number of large crates.
The number of small crates used cannot exceed MaxSmallCrates.
The number of large crates used cannot exceed MaxLargeCrates.
The total number of crates used cannot exceed MaxTotalCrates.
At least MinLargeCrates large crates must be used.

objective.description: The total number of grapes transported is the sum of the grapes in small crates and large crates. The objective is to maximize the total number of grapes transported.
